programmes.show_description: Sketch meets Gaz, who has his best friend's initials in an intimate place and wants a cover-up. And Jay gives Lady Gaga superfan Harry the portrait of his dreams.
Greg Davies hands down brutally honest judgements as five comics fight among themselves to win his golden head. Today: the pink, the powerful and the pirate.
Jimmy Carr hosts as David Mitchell and Cariad Lloyd take on Jon Richardson and Russell Howard. Sam Simmons joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
In Essex, there are deep-fried jam sandwiches and some attention-grabbing burlesque, as three couples compete to host the best dinner party.
In Cheshire, bossy Faye and Chris play it safe with tried-and-tested family favourites, romantic Mark and Shaun serve a wholesome menu, and chatterbox Dawn and Keith plan ambitious dishes.
The One with All the Kangaroos: For his wedding reception, Paddy transforms a tent in a country pub car park into a mock-up of the Australian bar where he and bride-to-be Breda first met.
The Game of Thrones One: Game of Thrones fan Owen dreams of a windswept mountain landscape for his wedding ceremony. Will his bride Lisa be happy to arrive on horseback, sporting a cloak?
The One in a Furniture Store: Celina wants an elegant, intimate wedding in a historical building, but Ben has other ideas. He has visions of them saying 'I do' in a huge furniture store.
The One with the DIY Wedding Dress: Nikki dreams of getting married in the lap of luxury, somewhere warm and indoors, but Jamie wants to create his own Wedfest at a glamping site.
The One with the Childhood Sweethearts: Liza pictures a country estate with a plush marquee and a wedding reception filled with elegance. Dean wants to recreate a 1980s Valentine's disco...
Xavier Mufraggi, the CEO of Club Med North America, goes undercover, disguised as a laid-back surfer, in his own resorts, to see the impact that his growth plans are having.
As CEO, Wan Kim has doubled Smoothie King's number of stores and tripled sales. He goes undercover to find out what his changes have meant for his employees and customers.
The Prohibition Grille: Gordon visits the Prohibition Grille in Washington State, where restaurateur Rishi is oblivious to the disastrous dishes being made in her own kitchen.
Chappy's: Gordon visits Chappy's in Tennessee, where the chef and owner's careless methods and less-than-appetising food have hurt his restaurant's local reputation.
Amy's Baking Company: At Amy's Baking Company in Scottsdale, Arizona, Gordon Ramsay meets a husband and wife team with a shocking contempt for customer feedback.
Return to Amy's Baking Company: Gordon revisits the most contentious restaurant he's ever tried to rescue - Amy's Baking Company, in Scottsdale, Arizona.
Pantaleone's: In Colorado, Gordon visits Italian restaurant Pantaleone's, whose stubborn owner Pete claims that he makes 'the best pizza in Denver'. Sadly, Gordon doesn't agree.
...New Year Special: Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and Richard Osman take on Johnny Vegas and Sara Pascoe. With David O'Doherty, Joe Wilkinson, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan take on Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. The Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
An extended edition of the second show with Jimmy Carr, Sean Lock and Jon Richardson, with guests Sarah Millican, Joe Wilkinson, Nick Grimshaw and Ollie Locke from Made in Chelsea.
An extended edition of the show. Craig Revel Horwood, David O'Doherty, Rick Edwards and Ellie Taylor join Jimmy Carr, Sean Lock and Jon Richardson to thrash out more hot topics.
...New Year Special: Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and Richard Osman take on Johnny Vegas and Sara Pascoe. With David O'Doherty, Joe Wilkinson, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan take on Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. The Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
The Thomas Shelby Wannabe One: Jane wants a country house wedding extravaganza, but Colm chooses a 1920s-themed reception at a race track featuring gangsters, gambling and the Charleston.
The One with a Christmas Wedding in August: Robbie aims to surprise Jenny with a Christmas wedding in August, featuring reindeer, bridesmaids wearing Santa dresses, and turkey on the menu.
The One with All the Wizards: In Dublin, Harry Potter fan Brendan becomes a wedding wizard, but will his stylish Mexican partner Victor be spellbound by dragons, cauldrons, and broomsticks?
Colie Edison created every element of the bowling giant Bowlero. Now she goes undercover to find out how the brand is working for staff and customers.
Mayor Adrian Perkins of Shreveport, Louisiana, is the city's second youngest mayor and in charge of 3000 employees. He goes undercover, hoping to change the city's fortunes.
In Plymouth, Christine and Kevin serve a menu that even Christine isn't convinced about. Harvey and Natasha throw a Spanish fiesta. And will nerves get the better of Paul and Jo?
Three couples put their hosting skills to the test on Jersey, in a week featuring wedding talk, a chinchilla dinner guest and cocktails from a fake cow...
On Guernsey and Alderney, Sophie and Turk show off the local produce, Dudley and Karla serve an authentic South African feast, and Bobbie and Jamie feel the pressure.
In south London, there are evil glares, a rooftop rave and a cooking meltdown on the hottest day of the year, as three couples compete to host the best dinner party.
Old Neighborhood: Gordon visits Arvada in Colorado, where out-of-control hoarder Randy and his wife Alexa have allowed their restaurant Old Neighborhood to fall into disrepair.
Kati Allo: Gordon's in New York, where the stress of running a Greek restaurant has driven Manny and Christine to the brink of divorce, with their daughter stuck in the middle.
Mangia Mangia (Part 1/2): Gordon visits an Italian restaurant with an identity crisis in Colorado, for the first half of a two-part Nightmare. The owner is at breaking point.
Mangia Mangia (Part 2/2): Gordon returns to Colorado to conclude his attempt to help an Italian restaurant. Can he work his magic on a menu that relies on a microwave?
Zayna Flaming Grill (Part 1/2): Gordon makes the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant in Redondo Beach owned by Faye and her niece Brenda.

programmes.show_name: The Big Fat Quiz of Telly
programmes.show_description: Who shot Mr Burns? What are The Chasers' nicknames? And what's 'The Peppa Effect'? Harry Hill, Judi Love, Tom Allen, Joanne McNally, Sam Campbell and Susan Wokoma take Jimmy Carr's TV test.
Stacey Solomon, Darren Harriott, Thomas Skinner and Sarah Keyworth join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Rob Beckett and Katherine Ryan for more topical comedy.
